entry.title: Use command 'reset' to reset your terminal display when output is garbled.
entry.content: I feel shamed that I haven’t found this simple command for a decade. Previously, I just closed the window or the terminal and re-opened. But this ‘reset’ command is the right way to do. Try it next time when your terminal display looks funny and out of control.

entry.title: Wired MinGW Make failure problem
entry.content:
Today when I tried to build wxWidgets with MinGW, I kept running into this wired problem.

process_begin: CreateProcess(….) failed. make (e=2): The system cannot find the file specified.

The problem was solved by reading this post http://www.allegro.cc/forums/print-thread/593750

I put Cygwin bash.exe and sh.exe into Windows PATH environment variable which make MinGW Make unhappy.

entry.title: Linux 'ldd' equivalence on Cygwin?
entry.content: Run “cygcheck” and see if all DLLs it requires can be found. I used it on Cygwin to solve a shared library missing problem when I started octave. The lapack library(.dll) was not loaded because of its path was not in $PATH.
